issue.title: Numba numpy

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
<!--
Thanks for contributing a pull request! Please ensure you have taken a look
at our contribution guide: https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->
#### Reference Issues/PRs
fixes  https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/1563
using the six file change given in 
https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/1482

note that several errors are still raised on the install related to numpy versions, e.g. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9594042/142444466-c5ca1d46-8cdf-4e42-9eaa-1891f53d31ca.png)

we have tested it on two different windows machines, it all seems to work on code that does not need the soft dependencies. 

This also relates to 
https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/1372
and the soft dependencies, as there are problems with fbprophet,

pip install -e .[all_extras]

does not work on its own. Jay will post instructions below for dealing with that. I can now run pytest locally!

We have not added esig to soft deps, but can do so if its wanted, 

https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/1373


#### What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.

Fixes a clash between numpy and numba by simply fixing numpy to 1.20.0 using method described in #1563  

conda create --name sktime python=3.8
conda activate sktime
pip install -e .

now installs a working environment for the hard dependencies.

body: Filed this to hopefully remove fbprophet from package repositories:  https://github.com/facebook/prophet/issues/2074

Hi, I tried out what @freddyaboulton suggested. My `build_tools/requirements.txt` does not look like the one posted above (see down here). To reproduce this, I did the following:

* Created a `conda` environment named `sktime` with Python 3.8 and `pip`
* Followed the steps [here](https://www.sktime.org/en/latest/get_involved/contributing.html#git-and-github-workflow)
* In the `build_tools/requirements.txt` as follows, changed `fbprophet>=0.7.1` to `prophet>=1.0.0`. 
* Ran `pip install -r build_tools/requirements.txt`

The first time it tried to install `prophet` it failed, then installed `numpy` and then `pip` successfully installed `prophet` again. Note: in this way, the `pystan` version installed is `pystan-2.19.1.1`.

```
cython>=0.29.0
deprecated>=1.2.13
dtw_python>=1.1.5
esig==0.9.7
fbprophet>=0.7.1 --> prophet>=1.0.0
hcrystalball>=0.1.9
numba==0.53
numpy==1.19.3
pandas==1.1.5
pmdarima>=1.8.0,!=1.8.1
pyod>=0.8.0
pystan>=2.14,<3.0
pytest
pytest-cov
scikit-learn==0.24.*
scikit-posthocs
statsmodels==0.12.1
stumpy>=1.5.1,<=1.9.2
tbats>=1.1.0
tsfresh>=0.17.0
wheel
```

issue.title: [ENH] Upgrading to numpy 1.20

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body: sktime requires numpy <1.20. This severely limits its use in larger more modern projects. Moving to numpy 1.20 would help allow sktime to be used in more projects without causing dependency issues.

body:
Another notice: folks at darts use [these requirements](https://github.com/unit8co/darts/blob/master/requirements/prophet.txt) for prophet:

```
prophet>=1.0.0
pystan>=2.19.1.1,<3.0.0.0
```

Will try them as soon as I can, in theory they should work - as I noted above:

> Note: in this way, the pystan version installed is pystan-2.19.1.1.

Guess I will use these when I prepare the PR.

(A side mention: why is `pandas` frozen at 1.15?)

issue.title: DRAFT [MNT] Updated `build_tools/requirements.txt` to move from `fbprophet` to `prophet`

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
#### Reference Issues
Attempts to fix #1631.

#### What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.

Specific to prophet:

* Set upper limit on pystan version
* Moved from `fbprohet>=0.7.1` to `prophet>=1.0.0`.

More generally:

* groups dependencies so it's clear when each dependency is used (mirrors #1620):
  * `core dependencies` for the base sktime
  * `all_extras` for extensions
  * `dev` for contributors
* Relaxed constraint on all libraries except `numpy` (see #1787 and #1794)

#### What should a reviewer concentrate their feedback on?

We should test this across multiple OS and Python versions. I could test macOS with Python 3.8.12

#### Other notice

When `pip install -r build_tools/requirements.txt` is run, packages are collected; then **wheels are built**. When doing so, **`prophet` wheel fails to build because it is build before numpy is installed**. `pip` then installs the other dependencies and `prophet` too, but without building the wheel and using `setup.py`.

<details>
<summary> Full log</summary>

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
#### Reference Issues/PRs

Fixes #1631 


#### What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you have implemented.
-->

#### Does your contribution introduce a new dependency? If yes, which one?

<!--
If your contribution does add a new hard dependency, we may suggest to initially develop your contribution in a separate companion package in https://github.com/sktime/ to keep external dependencies of the core sktime package to a minimum.
-->

#### What should a reviewer concentrate their feedback on?

<!-- This section is particularly useful if you have a pull request that is still in development. You can guide the reviews to focus on the parts that are ready for their comments. We suggest using bullets (indicated by * or -) and filled checkboxes [x] here -->

#### Any other comments?
<!--
Please be aware that we are a loose team of volunteers so patience is necessary; assistance handling other issues is very welcome. We value all user contributions, no matter how minor they are. If we are slow to review, either the pull request needs some benchmarking, tinkering, convincing, etc. or more likely the reviewers are simply busy. In either case, we ask for your understanding during the review process.
-->

#### PR checklist
<!--
Please go through the checklist below. Please feel free to remove points if they are not applicable.
-->

##### For all contributions
- [ ] I've added myself to the [list of contributors](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/.all-contributorsrc).
- [ ] Optionally, I've updated sktime's [CODEOWNERS](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/CODEOWNERS) to receive notifications about future changes to these files.
- [ ] I've added unit tests and made sure they pass locally.

##### For new estimators
- [ ] I've added the estimator to the online documentation.
- [ ] I've updated the existing example notebooks or provided a new one to showcase how my estimator works.


<!--
Thanks for contributing!
-->

issue.body: It is very likely that the current package version for this feedstock is out of date. Checklist before merging this PR: - [ ] Dependencies have been updated if changed: see [upstream](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime) - [ ] Tests have passed - [ ] Updated license if changed and `license_file` is packaged Information about this PR: 1. Feel free to push to the bot's branch to update this PR if needed. 2. The bot will almost always only open one PR per version. 3. The bot will stop issuing PRs if more than 3 version bump PRs generated by the bot are open. If you don't want to package a particular version please close the PR. 4. If you want these PRs to be merged automatically, make an issue with @conda-forge-admin,`please add bot automerge` in the title and merge the resulting PR. This command will add our bot automerge feature to your feedstock. 5. If this PR was opened in error or needs to be updated please add the `bot-rerun` label to this PR. The bot will close this PR and schedule another one. If you do not have permissions to add this label, you can use the phrase @conda-forge-admin, please rerun bot in a PR comment to have the `conda-forge-admin` add it for you. Pending Dependency Version Updates -------------------- Here is a list of all the pending dependency version updates for this repo. Please double check all dependencies before merging. | Name | Upstream Version | Current Version | |:----:|:----------------:|:---------------:| |numpy|1.22.2|[![Anaconda-Server Badge](https://img.shields.io/conda/vn/conda-forge/numpy.svg)](https://anaconda.org/conda-forge/numpy)| |sktime|0.10.0|[![Anaconda-Server Badge](https://img.shields.io/conda/vn/conda-forge/sktime.svg)](https://anaconda.org/conda-forge/sktime)| This PR was created by the [regro-cf-autotick-bot](https://github.com/regro/cf-scripts).
